Description: Fragment of oval handle from neck join to sharpish turn of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine accreted. Rectangular stamp.
Curator's comments: Ink, deleted, '454'. Name Alexiadas. An example in the Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto, is from the same die, as is probably Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, MGR 199.07.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (12)
